description: Premier Rene Levesque of Quebec virtually closed the door today to any new negotiations to end his province's opposition to a constitutional accord signed last week in Ottawa by the federal Government and the nine predominantly English-speaking provinces.

title: NORANDA MINES LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Includes gains on ale of investments of $41.7 million in the qr and $118.2 million for the 9 mos...C-Includes a $46.8 million gain on sale of fixed assets in the qr and the 9 mos; the company is listed on the Toronto, Montreal and Vancouver stock exchanges

title: BRITISH DOUBT CAMP DAVID TERMS CAN BRING A MIDEAST PEACE
description: Britain's tactics on the Middle East peace process, which have alarmed officials in Washington and brought a rebuke from Secretary of State Alexander M. Haig Jr., were described today by Foreign Office officials as ''the natural outgrowth of a basically different assessment of what will work best.''

title: Talking Scanner to Be Tried
description: Starting tomorrow, shoppers at the Grand Union store in Stratford, Conn., will be hearing a friendly female voice reciting the cost of the items they are purchasing, the total and the amount of change they have coming. The source of the entire litany will be an amplifying box on a display pole adjacent to the electronic cash register.

title: Trinidad's Ruling Party Gains in Election
description: The People's National Movement, which has ruled this Caribbean island nation for 25 years, swept to victory today in voting for a new Parliament.

title: Sears Tender Bid
description: Sears, Roebuck & Company said that about 1.45 million common shares of Coldwell, Banker & Company, the real estate brokerage firm, were tendered and accepted by midnight last Friday in reponse to the retailer's $42-a-share cash tender offer. The offer is subject to approval by shareholders of Coldwell, Banker at a special meeting Dec. 28. Each remaining Coldwell, Banker common share will be exchanged for 2.314 to 2.828 shares of Sears's common, depending on the market price of Sears's shares from this Thursday through Nov. 18.

title: FATAL GENETIC FLAW OFFERS 'HUMAN LAB' TO TEST THEORIES ON CHOLESTEROL
description: DALLAS CHOLESTEROL, a vital substance but a lethal one when it gets in the wrong places, is never more deadly than in people born with a genetic defect that dooms them to an early death from heart disease.

title: Gas Rates Rise
description: NEWARK (UPI) - The State Board of Public Utilities Commissioners approved yesterday a $16.5 million rate increase for the South Jersey Gas Company to offset expected higher wholesale costs for natural gas.

title: FOR AGUIRRE, A YEAR OF PRESSURED GROWTH
description: During the pre-game warmup drill Friday night before the Knicks and Mavericks met, Michael Ray Richardson walked across the court and introduced himself to Mark Aguirre, the rookie from De Paul. They clasped hands and spoke briefly.

title: JUSTICE DEPT. SEEKS EASY ACCESS TO FILES OF REVENUE SERVICE
description: The Justice Department asked Congress today to make it easier for the Internal Revenue Service to share secret tax information with Federal agents investigating nontax crimes.

title: No Headline
description: TIMES WINS 23 DESIGN PRIZES

title: Q&A
description: Q. How are temperatures of objects in space measured from the earth?

title: SUPRON ENERGY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After an extraordinary charge from settlement of litigation of $2,979,000 in qr and the 9 mos; the 1980 shrs outstndg and shr earnings reflect a 2-for-1 stock split paid June 15, 1981

title: IN CHINA, MILLIONS USE FUEL PRODUCED FROM WASTES
description: PEKING CHINA, a land where almost no natural resource goes overlooked, has mounted the world's largest and most determined effort to generate substantial quantities of methane gas for rural household use by fermenting human and animal wastes.

title: MOVES TO REPLACE RICKOVER REPORTED
description: John F. Lehman Jr., the Secretary of the Navy, has recommended the replacement of 81-year-old Adm. Hyman G. Rickover, the almost legendary naval officer credited with being the father of the United States nuclear navy, Pentagon sources said today.

title: Saudis Agree To Refinery
description: Two American oil companies and the Saudi Arabian state oil company said they had agreed to build the world's largest lubrication oil refinery at a cost of about $1 billion.

title: LETTERS
description: I am writing concerning ''Teachers Reward Muddy Prose, Study Finds.'' As a college graduate with a major in English, to whom the Chairman of the English Department once said, ''You have an admirably condensed method of expressing yourself (on paper),'' I must say (there I go, why not just say it!) that your example of ''clear '' prose sounded childish and uninteresting in this article.

title: Cavs Top Bulls, 102-101
description: Bobby Wilkerson hit a layup with four seconds remaining to give the Cleveland Cavaliers a 102-101 victory over the Chicago Bulls tonight. Wilkerson played with the Bulls last season before signing with the Cavaliers as a free agent. James Edwards topped Cleveland scorers with 22 points.

title: INDUCED RECESSION IS NO INFLATION CURE
description: To the Editor:

title: RATE DROP PICKS UP MOMENTUM
description: The decline in interest rates gained momentum yesterday, with some short-term rates declining almost a percentage point. The decline in short- and long-term rates has been steep since Oct. 28, with three-month Treasury bill rates falling almost two percentage points, to 11.128 percent, while 30-year Treasury bond yields have dropped about one and a half percentage points, to 13.53 percent. The prime lending is also declining, and yesterday major banks announced a half-point cut, to 17 percent, from the 18 percent figure set on Oct. 28. (Page D14.)

title: VISION OF ST. BART'S RECTOR PUSHES TOWER DEAL AHEAD
description: He has never designed a building or sketched a dome or vault, but the Rev. Thomas Dix Bowers is, as much as any man, the architect for an office tower next to St. Bartholomew's Episcopal Church on Park Avenue.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: PICASSO

title: Baseball Fan Sentenced To 26 Weekends in Jail
description: A man who threw a beer bottle at Dennis Martinez, the Baltimore Oriole pitcher, during a rain delay at Comiskey Park was sentenced today to serve 26 weekends in jail and to pay for the cost of his cell and food there. He will begin serving the sentence Dec. 5.

title: 2 PANELS INDICT 17 MILK DEALERS IN PRICE-FIXING
description: Grand juries in Brooklyn and Queens yesterday accused 17 major milk distributors and 28 of their top executives and employees of a decadelong conspiracy to fix prices in the metropolitan area.

title: ONLY NEW YORK CITY EXCLUDED IN NEW AID BY STATE TO LOCALITIES
description: Every city, village, town and county outside New York City will soon be getting some extra aid from the state under a bill signed today by Governor Carey.

title: ABOUT EDUCATION
description: CHILDREN are watching more television than ever but the networks are providing less television made for children. Action for Children's Television (ACT), an organization for the improvement of children's programs, charges that the commercial channels have been ''backsliding,'' after a few years of modest progress, and that the Federal Communications Commission, by joining the national trend against regulation, has abandoned children to a television marketplace in which they have neither voice nor political clout.

title: Newmont Gold Reserves Rise
description: The Newmont Mining Corporation, a major producer of copper, gold, silver, oil, coal, cement and lithium, said that three new gold discoveries at properties in Nevada and southern California had raised its total proven reserves of the metal to 7 million ounces from 4.1 million.

title: Youths on West Bank Protest Closing of an Arab University
description: Palestinian youths demonstrated today against the Israeli military government's closing of Bir Zeit University on the occupied West Bank, the Israeli radio said.

title: BRIEFS
description: * Capital Cities Communications Inc. said it had completed its acquisition of the Atlanta-area radio station WBIE from the privately held Marietta Broadcasting Co. for about $7.5 million.

title: LETTERMAN REPLACING SNYDER
description: NBC announced yesterday that a one-hour entertainment show starring the comedian David Letterman would take over the slot occupied for eight years by the ''Tomorrow'' show starring Tom Snyder.

title: POLISH PROSECUTOR DISMISSED
description: The Government dismissed Prosecutor General Lucjan Czubinski today, the official press agency reported. Mr. Czubinski, a former army general, was replaced by Franciszek Rusek, the press agency said. It gave no reason for the dismissal of Mr. Czubinski, who had been criticized by Solidarity, the independent trade union. Mr. Rusek has specialized in labor relations as president of the Supreme Court's labor and social welfare chamber.

title: BALLET: ANN MARIE DE ANGELO
description: THERE are some dancers with so much character that creating a sense of character, in fact, is totally natural to them. The perfect illustration was the vibrant, oustanding debut by Ann Marie De Angelo as Katherine in ''The Taming of the Shrew'' on Sunday afternoon at the City Center-55th Street Theater.

title: COWBOYS RALLY TO TOP BILLS
description: Tony Dorsett made the big play for the Dallas Cowboys tonight against the Bills. Dorsett's 73-yard touchdown on a pass-run play came on the first play from scrimmage of the second half, and signaled a turnaround in a game that had been all Buffalo.

title: F.B.I. Agent Says Player Confessed; MICHAEL STRAUSS
description: The Government concluded its case in the Boston College pointshaving trial yesterday after an agent for the Federal Bureau of Investigation testified that Rick Kuhn, a former player on the school's basketball team, voluntarily confessed in September 1980 that he shaved points in a game against Harvard during the 1978-79 season.

title: COMPUGRAPHIC CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 3
ROYAL BANK TO BUY CIT CANADIAN UNIT
description: The RCA Corporation's CIT Financial Corporation unit said yesterday that it was selling its Canadian business to the Royal Bank of Canada.

title: Steel Output Off
description: Steel production fell to 1.903 million tons in the week ended last Saturday, a decrease of 1 percent from the previous week's 1.922 million tons, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: NOT SO VITAL STATISTICS
description: For trivia collectors and others interested in Secretary of State Alexander M. Haig Jr., a selection of essential tidbits about the man who presides over Foggy Bottom:

title: Funny Money for Housing
description: After being debated for years, housing vouchers for the poor are an idea whose time may finally have come. Samuel Pierce, Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, says the Reagan Administration intends to follow a Presidential commission's proposal that Federal subsidies be shifted from the construction and rehabilitation of apartments to simply helping poor people pay rent.

title: News Analysis
description: The decertification of the air traffic controllers' union last month was taken by many as a turning point in the labor dispute that might lead to some accommodation between the Government and the dismissed strikers.

title: TIMES EDITOR SEES PRESS UNDER FIRE
description: The process essential to a free American press is ''under serious attack'' from a profession that has traditionally been its ally, the executive editor of The New York Times said tonight.

title: News Summary; TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 10, 1981
description: International Israeli military action in Lebanon is in prospect unless American diplomacy produces results, according to Defense Minister Ariel Sharon. He mentioned no deadline, but cited increasing dangers posed by Syrian missile sites in Lebanon and a heavy weapons buildup by the Palestine Liberation Organization. (Page A1, Column 1.) Britain's tactics for Mideast peace, which are strongly opposed by Washington, were described by London officials as ''the natural outgrowth of a basically different assessment of what will work best.'' The difference, they said, goes back to 1978, when Western European officials reacted with private skepticism to the Camp David accords because they believed the agreements failed to provide a framework for a resolution of the problem of the Palestinian Arabs. (A12:3-6.)

title: BENDIX NET IS UP 40.6% IN QUARTER
description: The Bendix Corporation reported yesterday that earnings in the fourth fiscal quarter of 1981 ended Sept. 30 climbed 40.6 percent while revenues edged up three-tenths of 1 percent.

title: OVER 65% OF BLACK APPLICANTS FAIL TEST FOR FLORIDA TEACHERS
description: Two-thirds of the blacks who took Florida's latest teacher certification exam failed the test, while most of the whites passed, according to state Department of Education figures released today.

title: WASHINGTON CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including extraordinary credits of $155,144 for the qr and $893,324 for the 9 mos...C-Including extraordinary credits of $218,827 for the qr and $1,073,126 for the 9 mos; the company is listed on the Philadelphia Stock Exchange

title: COVERING THE WRONG WOUNDS
description: Self-examination sessions by the press can be predictable, dominated by large, articulate egos, and dull. But one such panel discussion two weeks ago - at Automation House - erupted from blandness into a passion unanticipated either by its sponsors or by most of the 200 in the audience.

title: The President Gags on Voting Rights
description: President Reagan says he cherishes the right to vote, but takes perverse exception to the pending extension of the Federal Voting Rights Act. Key sections of the law expire next year, and he was said by aides to be ready to sign whatever Congress produced. Now, however, Mr. Reagan has heeded one last pitch from Attorney General Smith, for a watered-down endorsement of a watered-down bill. That was bad advice, badly taken.

title: Caron Creme Fraiche Assignment Is Made
description: The State of Maine Cheese Company in Camden, Me., has assigned the introduction of its Caron Creme Fraiche, a cultured French cream, to Warriner, Mandelbaum, Palladino.

title: Sealed Power Unit Sets Acquisition
description: The Sealed Power Corporaton, a leading producer of piston rings and other engine parts, and the Kent-Moore Corporation, a manufacturer of specialty service tools and equipment, said they had entered into an agreement for a subsidiary of Sealed Power to acquire Kent-Moore.

title: LATINS IN MIAMI GIRD FOR RUNOFF TODAY
description: Miami's Latin community was humiliated a year ago when non-Latin whites and blacks got together at the polls and voted to prohibit local government from spending money to make services and signs bilingual. At the time Latin leaders vowed to fight back with large voter registration drives.

title: RCA SATELLITE SALE AT SOTHEBY
description: In a hushed Sotheby Park Bernet auction hall, as tense cable television executives signaled with paddles, a sale of communications satellite facilities for their booming industry brought $90.1 million in winning bids yesterday.

title: OFFICIAL TALLIES SHOW KEAN LEADING IN JERSEY
description: New Jersey's counties submitted their official vote tallies to the state yesterday, and they showed former Assembly Speaker Thomas H. Kean with a narrow lead over Representative James J. Florio in the race for Governor.

title: KDI CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including $712,000 nonrecurring gain from the settlement of a lawsuit, a fire insurance claim settlement and reduction in a precious metals LIFO inventory; the yr-ago results include sales of $2.4 million for the qr and $7.1 million for the 9 mos attributable to KDI companies sold in 1980

title: 2 Concerts Will Offer Contemporary Chamber
description: Two concerts of contemporary chamber music are scheduled at Carnegie Recital Hall next month. On Dec. 10, the New Music Consort will present the New York premiere of Ruth Crawford Seeger's Suite No. 2 for Piano and Strings, Louis Karchin's Capriccio for Violin and Seven Instruments and Allen Anderson's ''Skies, the Quake.''

title: News Analysis
description: The designation of the smart, solid blocks of the Upper East Side between Fifth and Park Avenues as a historic district earlier this year gave the Landmarks Preservation Commission the right to pass on any new buildings or major architectural changes proposed for the area. At that point it seemed to most observers that the commission's role would be fairly clear-cut -it was assumed that it would keep big white-brick apartment towers out of the neighborhood, and offer a supportive nod to small-scale construction and brownstone renovations.

title: CABOT CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Includes income from discontinued operations of $48.4 million for the qr and $58.7 million for the yr

title: BENDIX CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including income from discontinued operations of $8,984,000 for the qr and $57,348,000 for the yr...C-Including $248,310,00 income from discontinued operations

title: News Analysis
description: Without once firing, a Soviet submarine may have torpedoed the concept of a nuclear-free Nordic zone. The plan for such a neutral zone, orginally proposed some decades ago by Finland's President, Urho Kekkonen, has reappeared in various versions. Essentially, all of them provide for creation of a neutral area composed of the Nordic nations: Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden. In exchange for banning nuclear weapons within their own borders, these countries would ask the two superpowers, the United States and the Soviet Union, to guarantee that nuclear weapons would never be used against them.

title: Ludwig Wolpert, a Sculptor Of Jewish Objects, Dies at 81
description: Ludwig Wolpert, sculptor of Jewish ceremonial objects and an artist-in-residence at the Jewish Museum in Manhattan, died Friday at Mount Sinai Medical Center. He was 81 years old and a resident of Manhattan.

title: BRONX WOMAN, 94, DIES IN STATE THEATER FALL
description: An elderly Bronx woman fell to her death from the top balcony of the New York State Theater at Lincoln Center, and the New York City Medical Examiner's Office said yesterday that she had died from injuries suffered in the fall.

title: BAIRD CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Goldwater Has Hip Replaced
description: Senator Barry Goldwater's left hip was replaced by a prosthetic device in surgery here today, a spokesman for St. Luke Hospital said. The 72-year-old Arizona Republican was in satisfactory condition after the surgery, said the spokesman, Robert Lundin. Mr. Lundin said the operation went well and that Mr. Goldwater was expected to be hospitalized for 10 to 14 days. Mr. Goldwater had similar surgery on his right hip several years ago, Mr. Lundin said.

title: A Royal Banker to Wed
description: He is a 27-year-old banker in Brussels and bears the title, if not the office, of Archduke of Austria. That makes Christian of Hapsburg- Lorraine an ideal catch for a princess, and now Princess Marie-Astrid of Luxembourg has caught him.

title: Child Seeks Aid
description: A Kinnelon, N.J., couple, Joseph and Beatrice Toohey, pleaded for help for their only child, a 2 1/2-year-old girl with liver cancer who needs an organ transplant from someone who has been pronounced brain dead but whose heart is still beating.

title: Dispute on Discipline
description: With the head coach, John Merritt, lying ill in a hospital, the announced intention of Joe Gilliam Sr. to resign as assistant coach added to the tribulations of the Tennessee State football team, and school officials said yesterday they would urge Gilliam to reconsider. Gilliam said only that he wanted to return to teaching, but it seemed apparent that his plan to quit at the end of this season was related to an incident in which several members of the team reportedly were caught stuffing things in their pockets in a gift shop of Atlanta Airport on Oct. 30.

title: Ford Prepares Tractor Line
description: Despite declining sales in the tractor industry, the Ford Motor Company said it would introduce a line of tractors in January for sale in North America.

title: No Headline
description: GENE MAYER DEFEATS BROTHER

title: Jonathan Logan Deficit
description: Jonathan Logan Inc., a garment house, said yesterday that it had a loss of $12.3 million in the third quarter, compared with a profit of $5.6 million, or $1.08 a share, a year earlier. The company attributed the loss to a September decision to shut down textile manufacturing operations. Revenues declined to $132.39 million from $141.36 million, the company said.

title: CLEAN AIR ACT MAY BE A TURNING POINT IN CONGRESS
description: The debate over revising the Clean Air Act is the main event in Congress this year that involves environmental legislation. The outcome may set a pattern for the 97th Congress in making critical choices involving environmental protection on one hand and economic and resource values on the other.

title: JACKSON IS REPORTED WILLING TO TRY OUT AS FIRST BASEMAN
description: Now playing first base for the New York Yankees ... Reggie Jackson. Reggie Jackson? Jackson's agent, Gary Walker, raised that possibility yesterday as he and George Steinbrenner, the man who can determine Jackson's future with the Yankees, kept missing each other with telephone calls.

title: BEAN SOUP, ROAST BEEF AND A CAPITAL LOCATION
description: To gain entry into most restaurants, all one needs is a reservation, and sometimes a jacket and tie. To get into the dining room reviewed here, however, you will have to be elected to the Senate. Whatever other rewards and satisfactions that job may bring, the cost and effort of running for election will hardly seem worthwhile if lavish lunches are what you have in mind, judging by food and service sampled there last week.

title: WORLDWIDE ENERGY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Net income; there was a shutdown of a tungsten mine in England resulting in a $600,000 loss in the third qr and $800,000 in the 9 mos

title: Acid Rain Called Peril to Ontario Lakes
description: Acid rain has damaged at least 86 Ontario lakes and many others could suffer unless American and Canadian industries reduce sulfur emissions, according to an Ontario environmental official.

title: Falling Rates Spur Stocks
description: Falling interest rates propelled utility and other interestsensitive stock prices higher yesterday, as the American Telephone and Telegraph Company traded at its highest price since 1979.

title: Youth Arrested in Rape And Slaying of a Nun
description: A 17-year-old Amarillo youth was arrested late today in the strangulation and rape of a 76-year-old Franciscan nun.

title: Con Edison Loses
description: Secretary of Labor Raymond J. Donovan ordered Consolidated Edison to reinstate a mechanic who contended that he was dismissed last January because he had complained about safety hazards at the utility's Indian Point 2 nuclear plant at Buchanan, N.Y.

title: Key Rates
description: * Rates are before any surcharges on loans to large banks that are frequent borrowers.** Maximum rate payable by savings institutions.Salomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: NATHAN'S FAMOUS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 27
description: B-Including tax credits of $159,000 for the qr and $300,000 for the 6 mos...C-Including tax credits of $72,650 for the qr and $93,650 for the 6 mos

title: IN MOSCOW, A BAD REVIEW OF BEST SELLER
description: What would a Soviet publisher do with a novel that starts off with disfigured corpses in Central Park, continues with dark intrigues involving city cops, F.B.I. agents, Russian detectives and Hollywood starlets, and winds up with everyone getting killed in a Moscow suburb and the recovery of Coca-Cola concealed in Greek amphorae by the director of a Soviet soda-pop bottling plant?

title: U.S. TROOPS ARRIVE IN EGYPT FOR WAR GAMES
description: The first contingent of American soldiers began arriving in Egypt today for the start of a three-week military exercise that the United States is conducting with Egypt, Somalia, the Sudan and Oman.

title: TAIWAN JET SALE NEAR APPROVAL, OFFICIALS REPORT
description: The Reagan Administration is near to approving the sale of advanced fighter planes to Taiwan, according to officials in the White House, the Defense Department and the State Department.

title: HOOVER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
TEXT OF THE C.I.A.'S STATEMENT
description: Following is the text of a statement released today by the Central Intelligence Agency on the activities of two former C.I.A. agents.

title: GIANTS RECALL CLACK
description: The Giants have probably lost Ernie Hughes, their starting center, for the rest of the National Football League season because of a knee injury. His replacement against the Washington Redskins Sunday at Giants Stadium may be his predecessor, Jim Clack.

title: ISRAEL JETS CHASED, SAUDIS SAY
description: Saudi Arabian fighters forced Israeli planes out of Saudi airspace today, the official Saudi press agency and the state radio said.

title: LYNDEN TRANSPORT INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including $180,630 tax benefit from the 1980 write-off of operating rights and $99,000 tax credit from Canadian subsidiaries...C-After $338,392 write-off of operating rights; the yr-ago shr earnings have been restated for a 3-for-1 stock split in the form of a 200 percent stock divd paid in June 1981

title: COONEY LAYS DOWN THE LAW TO HOLMES
description: Larry Holmes was floored in the seventh round before scoring an 11th-round knockout of Renaldo Snipes last Friday. But if Holmes wants to get sharper before his $10 million title defense against Gerry Cooney, he will have to do it in the gymnasium, Dennis Rappaport, a manager of the undefeated heavyweight challenger, said yesterday.

title: TYLAN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 2
LETTERS
description: TO SCIENCE TIMES: In Edward B. Fiske's article ''Teachers Reward Muddy Prose, Study Finds,'' it seems the researchers missed some probable reasons why high school teachers and college instructors give higher grades to verbose rather than terse compositions. A high school teacher of English is usually so inundated by compositions characterized by lack of interest, grammar and knowledge that a paper with sesquipedalianisms shows some effort and is rewarded.

title: Ex-General Takes Office As President of Burma
description: U San Yu, a 63-year-old retired army general and veteran politican, became president today, taking over from U Ne Win, the ailing leader who ruled this Southeast Asian nation for 19 years.

title: Article 086762 -- No Title
description: Three years ago, Barbara Taylor Bradford's first novel, ''A Woman of Substance,'' for which the author received a $25,000 advance from Doubleday, landed briefly on The New York Times best-seller list. Mrs. Bradford with Doubleday, for which she was to receive a $75,000 advance. But just recently she signed a two-book contract with Doubleday for, reportedly, $3 million.

title: JUDGE RULES BROKERAGE MUST BE LIQUIDATED
description: A Federal judge ruled today that a stock brokerage firm where securities worth an estimated total of $36 million were reported missing was insolvent and ordered the company liquidated.

title: Darcy's Houston Office Acquired by Doremus
description: Doremus & Company, which practices the crafts of advertising, public relations and graphic design as a subsidiary of Batten, Barton, Durstine & Osborn, has increased its reach into the Southwest by acquiring the Houston public relations office of Darcy Communications of Denver.

title: Snow in Yugoslavia Kills 17
description: The first snowfalls of the season fell in central and eastern Yugoslavia and at least 17 people were killed in road accidents over the weekend, the police said today. Icy roads, dense fog and the snow in mountainous areas south of Belgrade could be blamed for most of the accidents, they said.

title: The U.N. Today; Nov. 10, 1981; SECURITY COUNCIL
description: Meets at 10.30 A.M. GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: Cushman & Wakefield Elects a Top Executive
description: Stephen B. Siegel, 37, has been elected president, chief executive officer and chief operating officer of Cushman & Wakefield Inc., a major real estate brokerage, management and consulting organization. A 20-year veteran at the company, Mr. Siegel succeeds Vincent J. Peters, 58, who was named chairman when his 65-year-old brother Anthony decided to step down to the position of vice chairman.

title: ANNOTATING THE CITYWIDE READING TEST SCORES
description: To the Editor:

title: GENRAD INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After losses from discontinued operations of $1,525,000 for the qr and $3.1 million for the 9 mos...C-Net income after losses from discontinued operations of $513,000 for the qr and $1.2 million for the 9 mos and $731,000 gain for the 9 mos from an accounting change

title: Golfer Honored
description: Adele Lukken of Tulsa, twice the junior women's golf champion of Oklahoma and now playing for Southern Methodist University, has been named Golf Digest's Ms. Golf of 1981 in a poll of golf writers and broadcasters. Miss Lukken, who plays to a 3 handicap, will receive $350 in merchandise from the pro shop at her home club, Oak Hills. Previously she had attracted the attention of a Japanese calendar publisher, who will photograph her later this year for a calendar featuring young female golfers.

title: OIL PRICE RISE PUT AT 40 A BARREL
description: The average OPEC oil price has increased by only 40 cents a barrel as a result of the new price structure established by the group at its meeting in Geneva last month, the Department of Energy reported yesterday.

title: ALLIED MAINTENANCE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
PROPORTIONAL REPRESENTATION AS AN ALTERNATIVE TO REDISTRICTING
description: To the Editor:

title: LIFE SCIENCES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including $137,700 tax credit...C-Net loss

title: Books Of The Times
description: By Christopher Lehmann-Haupt RED DRAGON. By Thomas Harris. 348 pages. Putnam. $13.95.

title: BID FOR $3 BILLION IN TAXES DROPPED BY ADMINISTRATION
description: Donald T. Regan, the Secretary of the Treasury, said today that the Administration had dropped its proposal to raise $3 billion more in tax revenue in the 1982 fiscal year.

title: Carey Names Morgado to Housing Agency
description: Governor Carey has named his top aide, Robert J. Morgado, to a temporary unsalaried position on the board of the State Housing Finance Agency.

title: CENTEX CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including $27,424,000 gain on the sale of gas properties

title: Bridge: Sometimes a Sharp Player Prefers Void to a Singleton
description: In general a void is more valuable than a singleton, and the standard methods of distributional valuation recognize this. But there are situations in which a player would give his eyeteeth to trade a void for a small singleton.

title: Aid for the Suicidal
description: In the face of 250,000 suicide attempts made annually in the United States, doctors at Camarillo State Hospital near Los Angeles recently compared two types of treatment for repeated suicide attempters.

title: 4 DESIGNERS TOP 7TH AVENUE CLASS
description: Perry Ellis sent his fresh-faced mannequins into his salon in crisp cotton dresses, often made of men's shirtings. His mannequins - and his clothes - had a clean, outdoorsy look. His hemlines, reaching almost to the ankle, were the longest any designer showed for spring. Superimposed on a faintly old-fashioned look was an air of uncluttered modernity. Mr. Ellis is writing his own chapter in the story of American sportswear.

title: Angolan Warship Stops Italian Racing Yacht
description: An Italian yacht sailing in an aroundthe-world race was stopped by an Angolan warship and the crew was held for seven days as suspected South African spies, the race organizers said today.

title: NATIONAL VALVE & MANUFACTURING CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
9.6% RISE IN BUDGET SOUGHT IN NASSAU COUNTY BY PURCELL
description: The Nassau County Executive today proposed a 1982 operating budget that is 9.6 percent larger than last year's. The County Executive, Francis T. Purcell, said that county services would be maintained at their present level, but that the average Nassau homeowner would have to pay 5 percent more in taxes.

title: A New Perspective
description: Representative Barber B. Conable Jr., Republican of upstate New York, letter to his constituents: Congress is one of those not-very-lovable institutions which generates great negatives in the press. The easiest headline is commentary on the greed of Congressmen; the public press is frequently catching us in a posture that looks suspiciously like the old hand-in-the-cookie-jar routine. I want to try to give you a perspective on some of the things for which we have been criticized lately.

title: Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: PERSICO RANK RANKLES AS HE IS GIVEN 5 YEARS
description: Carmine Persico, reputedly a major figure in organized crime, was sentenced yesterday to five years in prison. There was no dispute over his sentence, a result of plea bargaining in a criminal conspiracy case. There was, however, a dispute over who Mr. Persico was.

title: LIMESTONE CENTER TURNS TO TOURISM
description: About 300 yards away from the hole that the Empire State Building came out of, and just west of the one they reopened especially for New York City's Cathedral of St. John the Divine, the Great Pyramid of Cheops slowly rises. Next to the Great Wall of China.

title: Successor Is Named To Creamer Presidency
description: Robert H. Lynch, 47 years old, has been named president of Creamer Inc./New England, succeeding Robinson C. Trowbridge, 53, who cofounded the agency 27 years ago with Donald Creamer. Mr. Trowbridge will become chairman of operations.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * Amarex Inc., Oklahoma City, has named Peter W. McCook senior vice president-administration.

title: S.E.C. SUIT ACCUSES GRUMMAN ON LTV
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission yesterday charged the Grumman Corporation with violating Federal law by making ''false and misleading statements'' in its campaign to rebuff a $450 million takeover bid by the LTV Corporation of Dallas.

title: MAY PETROLEUM INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: The yr-ago results have been restated

title: SALVADOR'S CHIEF REBUTS HAIG, SAYS WAR IS NOT STALEMATED
description: The President of El Salvador's civilianmilitary junta said last night that assertions by Secretary of State Alexander M. Haig Jr. that the civil war here was stalemated were ''not true.''

title: TELLING THE SOVIETS HOW BEST TO COPE
description: To the Editor:

title: PLAYBOY'S FALL IN BRAZIL AIDS FEMINIST AIM
description: A Brazilian jury last week returned a homicide conviction against a man whose earlier exoneration for having acted in defense of his male dignity had stirred a national women's campaign.

title: Canton and Los Angeles Plan To Set Up Twin-City Relations
description: Canton has agreed to resume talks with Los Angeles on setting up twin-city relations, the New China News Agency said today.

title: DAMON CREATIONS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
News Analysis
description: In 1979 the General Motors Corporation developed a five-year spending plan to run through 1984. The plan, created under the direction of Thomas A. Murphy, then chairman of General Motors, was based on the assumption that motorists wanted fuel economy more than anything else. The company calculated that ''downsizing'' its cars would cost about $40 billion.

title: BROADWAY'S TOUGH SIDE: CLOSING ON OPENING NIGHT
description: ''Ned and Jack,'' a new play at the Little Theater, closed yesterday after one performance. Peter Michael Goetz, who played John Barrymore, cleaned out his dressing room, returned the tuxedo he had rented for the opening-night party and drove home to Larchmont, N.Y., with Connie, his wife. Other actors had admired Mr. Goetz's bravura acting; the first-night audience had brought him back for three curtain calls. Theater, however, is a cruel profession, and sometimes talent has nothing to do with it. Mr. Goetz is now unemployed.

title: A QUESTION OF PRINCIPLE, NOT OF PARTY
description: To the Editor:

title: NEW PLAN REALTY TRUST reports earnings for Yr to July 31
TV: MEN AND SEX ON 'BODY HUMAN'
description: ''THE BODY HUMAN'' brings its series of afternoon ''informational specials'' on sexuality to an end this week with two half hours entitled ''The Loving Process - Men.'' They can be seen at 1:30 today and tomorrow on CBS-TV.

title: UNWINDING AT THE MALL
description: Lisa D'Amico is drifting through the Roosevelt Field shopping mall, needing nothing in particular other than to shop. ''I didn't really come today to buy anything,'' says the 32-year-old housewife, carrying a bag of designer jeans, cosmetics and Thanksgiving greeting cards purchased at stores in the mall. ''I'm just here for fun.''

title: CURBING THE JUDICIARY
description: Federal district judges are increasingly acting as day-to-day managers and implementers, reaching into the details of civic life: how prisons are run, medication is administered to the mentally ill, custody is arranged for severely deranged persons, private and public employers recruit and promote. Though judicial authority and democracy have always co-existed in tension, as Federal judges assume a more active managerial role, politicians and citizens chafe for quite pragmatic reasons.

title: AMBULANCE CREWS MAY GET AUTHORITY TO REFUSE PATIENTS
description: Mayor Koch said yesterday that he would consider giving New York City paramedics and emergency room physicians the authority to refuse emergency ambulance service to people they deemed not to require it.

title: Surgery Patients Get Toxic Shock
description: Toxic shock syndrome, usually found in women who use tampons, has now been discovered in a new group: men and women who undergo surgery.

title: India Balcony Crash Kills 7
description: A crowded balcony collapsed during a religious procession yesterday, killing 7 people and injuring more than 70 in this city 75 miles southeast of New Delhi. The United News of India said more than 100 people were on the balcony watching the procession.

title: COMPUCORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
ECONOMICS LABORATORY INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Yr-ago results have been restated to reflect changes in accounting

title: CUSTOM ALLOY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
TULSA KILLING IS STILL UNSOLVED
description: Roger Wheeler had just finished a round of golf when he was shot down at the exclusive Southern Hills Country Club. Five months later, despite a nationwide search for clues, police officers admit they have no new major leads.

title: THE DOCTOR'S WORLD
description: ray diagnosticians, radiologists are physicians who have traditionally looked at images on film to detect a myriad of disorders, but now they are moving from the viewing boxes in the back rooms to more direct roles in treating and diagnosing patients' illnesses.

title: TELERENT LEASING CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
'TIS ALMOST THE SEASON TO BE JOLLY, BUT NOT OUT IN HOLLYWOOD
description: The movie industry, experiencing the continual nagging pain of a dismal fall at the box office, is looking toward Christmas for relief - but without much real hope of a cure.

title: A Shower Enlisted in Fight Against Cancer
description: Attempts by college students trying to break into the Guinness Book of Records are old hat, but when the student involved is the daughter of a United States Senator, that is something else.

title: Stastnys Lead Quebec Over Red Wings by 5-3
description: Anton Stastny scored one goal and made three assists tonight in helping the Quebec Nordiques post a 5-3 victory over the Detroit Red Wings.

title: INVESCO INTERNATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including tax credits of $198,000 for the qr and $396,000 for the 9 mos...C-Net loss

title: Todd Finally in Control for Jets
description: Richard Todd went home today for a brief visit to Mobile, Ala. In the past Todd, the Jets' quarterback, has looked more comfortable tooling around the antebellum town -wearing an International Harvester tractor cap and driving his van - than he did wearing a football helmet and directing the Jets.

title: DATATAB INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After $2,000 extraordinary loss for the qr and $12,000 extraordinary gain for the 9 mos...C-Net loss

title: BROOKLYN DETECTIVE IS NAMED CHIEF OF POLICE IN BIRMINGHAM
description: Mayor Richard Arrington today named Arthur V. Deutcsh, a Brooklyn police captain, to head this city's 684-member police force, ending a 10-month standoff that became an issue in recent elections.

title: Market Place; Motor Maker Recommended
description: IN some regions of the land, aquifers have been drained to such a degree that it is difficult to recover the remaining water with surface pumps. That bad news for the nation is good news for the Franklin Electric Company, a major producer of submersible electric motors.

title: Howard B. Johnson Resigns His Posts
description: Howard B. Johnson, 49 years old, has resigned as chairman, president and chief executive officer of the Howard Johnson Company, which was founded by his father in 1925, effective Jan.1. He will be succeeded by G. Michael Hostage, 48, who is currently chairman and president of the ITT Continental Baking Company, a subsidiary of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation.

title: U.N. Team in Thailand Extends Inquiry Into Chemical Warfare
description: A United Nations team investigating the use of toxic chemicals by Vietnamese forces has extended its inquiry for four days after hearing of new cases among Laotian refugees in northern Thailand, an Interior Ministry spokesman said today.

title: Murder-Suicide Pact Is Seen in Three Deaths
description: A music teacher shot his mother and a close family friend, then turned the gun on himself in a murdersuicide pact carried out in a hotel suite, homicide inspectors said today.

title: C.I.A. DENIES ANY OFFICIAL ROLE IN LIBYA ACTIVITIES OF EX-AGENTS
description: The Central Intelligence Agency today denied any ''official involvement'' in the activities of Edwin P. Wilson and Frank E. Terpil, former agents who have been charged with illegally shipping explosives to Libya as part of a program to train terrorists.

title: MAYNARD OIL CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
CHRISTIANA COMPANIES reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including $1.3 million income from discontinued operations... C-After $507,000 loss from discontinued operations

title: RICHTON INTERNATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
U.S. JUDGE BARS LAWYER IN ROCKLAND THEFT CASE
description: A Federal judge barred a lawyer yesterday from representing Cynthia Boston, who was released last week after being held as a suspect in the Rockland County armored-car robbery on Oct. 20.

title: 11 Held at Gunpoint While Store Is Looted
description: Six gunmen held 11 persons at gunpoint in an appliance store here today for at least a half an hour and made off with cash and appliances worth an estimated $100,000 or more, the police said.

title: A MATTER OF SENSIBILITIES IN A SMALL GERMAN TOWN
description: This is a town of brick sidewalks, provincial purposefulness, and North Sea mists thick enough to make the trees look black and turn the rust-red walkways the color of sludge. It deals with November's glumness mostly by reflex: a beer, a sit in the cafe, a drive over to Wilhelmshaven for the movies.

title: RAY CORLEY
description: Ray Corley, author of the novels ''Air Force One'' and ''Genesis Rock,'' died of a heart attack on Saturday.

title: EVEREST & JENNINGS INTERNATIONAL reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After unrealized foreign currency translation losses of $1.1 million for the qr and $939,000 for the 9 mos... C-Net income...D-Including foreign currency translation gains of $256,000 or 5 cents a shr for the qr and $375,000 or 7 cents a shr for the 9 mos

title: CUOMO URGES CAREY TO VETO BILL ON PROPERTY TAXES
description: Lieut. Gov. Mario M. Cuomo yesterday urged Governor Carey to veto a bill recently passed by the Legislature that was meant to solve the state's six-year problem of New York's system of property tax assessment. That system has been ruled illegal by the courts.

title: ENOUGH OF APARTMENT PEOPLE CARRYING HOMEOWNERS
description: To the Editor:

title: INDIA WINS AN INTERNATIONAL LOAN OF $5.8 BILLION OVER U.S. PROTESTS
description: Over United States objections, the International Monetary Fund today approved a $5.8 billion loan to India to ease the difficulties it is facing as a result of higher prices for imported oil.

title: A.P.I. Parley Site of Protest
description: Oil executives attending the annual meeting of the American Petroleum Institute were greeted today by hundreds of protesters waving placards, shouting slogans and beating drums.

title: Man Slain on the West Side; Police Charge His Boarder
description: A 56-year-old man was beaten to death in his West Side studio apartment last night by a boarder he had asked to move out, the police reported.

title: ANNOTATING THE CITYWIDE READING TEST SCORES
description: To the Editor:

title: ISRAELI WARNS U.S. OF MILITARY MOVE IF DIPLOMACY FAILS
description: Defense Minister Ariel Sharon said today that Israel would take military action against Syrian missiles in Lebanon and against a heavy weapons buildup by the Palestine Liberation Organization unless American diplomacy produced results.

title: Nisei Reparations Fee Is Opposed by Inouye
description: Senator Daniel K. Inouye, Democrat of Hawaii, said yesterday he opposed setting a reparations fee for Japanese Americans who were incarcerated on the West Coast in World War II.

title: KOCH TERMS THE APPARENT DEFEAT OF PRISON BOND PLAN 'OUTRAGEOUS'
description: Mayor Koch last night denounced the apparent defeat of the statewide prison bond issue as ''outrageous,'' and said that opponents who had led the fight against the proposal would ''have on their heads'' any crimes committed by people who otherwise might have been in jail.

title: COLONIAL PENN GROUP INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
MRS. REAGAN TO PARENTS: 'BE TOUGH' ON DRUGS
description: Nancy Reagan all but blamed drug addiction on the nation's parents today and advised them to get tough, even if it means ''losing your child for a while.''

title: 18 Die in Mexican Jet Crash
description: A Mexican DC-9 jet crashed into a rugged mountain slope, killing all 12 passengers and 6 crew members on board, the authorities said today. The Aeromexico jet struck a mountain side late yesterday near the city of Altamirano, 120 miles southwest of Mexico City, an airline spokesman said. The cause of the accident was not known.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''It's nice to be back.'' - James S. Brady, White House press secretary. (B14:1.)

title: Mugabe Visits Yugoslavia
description: Prime Minister Robert Mugabe of Zimbabwe flew to Belgrade today for an official visit and was welcomed by his Yugoslav counterpart, Veselin Djuranovic, and other top officials.

title: BELGIUM'S KING REVIEWS VOTE
description: King Baudouin called in Mark Eyskens, the outgoing Prime Minister, today to discuss Belgium's political situation after general elections yesterday that split votes almost equally among three major parties.

title: Supreme Court Rejects Suit on Canceled Games
description: The Supreme Court refused today to hear a lawsuit against West Virginia University over two canceled football games between that school and San Jose State.

title: BRAND INSULATIONS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including tax credits of $169,000 or 14 cents a shr for the qr and $217,000 or 18 cents a shr for the 9 mos... C-Including tax credits of $110,000 or 14 cents a shr for the qr and $888,000 or $1.13 a shr for the 9 mos

title: G.O.P. ORGANIZER PLOTS STRATEGY TO WIN HOUSE
description: Nancy Sinnott has $35 million to spend and she is still worried. What happens, she frets, if the voters expect too much, too soon, from President Reagan's economic program?

title: MORE RED INK AT THRIFT UNITS
description: After the record losses reported by New York savings banks in the second quarter, it seemed things could hardly have gotten worse. But they have.

title: BERKLEY, W R, CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Yr-ago results have been adjusted for a 7 percent stock divd in July

title: WORK HABITS IN CHILDHOOD FOUND TO PREDICT ADULT WELL-BEING
description: THE willingness and capacity to work in childhood is the most important forerunner - more than native intelligence, social class or family situation -of mental health in adulthood, according to the results of a newly published study.

title: CANADIAN PACIFIC LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Syria Holds Elections For a New Parliament
description: Syrians voted today to elect a new Parliament whose members will hold four-year terms. The Damascus radio reported a heavy turnout as more than 1,500 candidates contested the 195 seats in the unicameral legislature known as the People's Council.

title: Jane R. Pike, Researcher, 51; Subject of TV Cancer Show
description: Jane R. Pike, a scientific researcher whose battle with cancer became the subject of a Public Broadcasting Service televison program, is dead at the age of 51.

title: MAYOR AND REGAN DIFFER ON EFFECTS OF U.S. CUTS
description: New York State's Comptroller told a Congressional committee yesterday that the Federal budget cuts enacted to date should have ''no impact on New York City's financial plan'' for the next four years.

title: Long Count in New Jersey
description: It may be weeks before anyone knows who has won the governorship of New Jersey, but the photo finish between Thomas Kean and James Florio leaves little doubt about another matter: the procedures for counting ballots need to be changed.

title: CREEPING TO THE RIGHT
description: President Reagan's foreign policy can't even keep the peace between the State Department and the White House. His economic program is producing recession, the highest unemployment since 1975 and war between David Stockman and the Treasury. Secretaries Haig and Weinberger contradict each other on NATO nuclear doctrine, then claim they didn't.

title: VISUAL GRAPHICS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 27
NEW COUNT SHOWS PRISON BONDS FAIL
description: According to a new, unofficial count of election returns throughout New York State, a $500 million bond issue for the improvement and expansion of prisons has apparently been defeated.

title: BOLIVIA PUTTING ITS HOPES IN PRIVATE ENTERPRISE
description: Bolivia's military Government has announced a new economic plan that calls for the transfer of badly managed Government enterprises to the private sector in a bid to end the country's economic crisis.

title: NICARAGUA DENIES AMERICAN CHARGES
description: Senior Nicaraguan officials charged today that the Reagan Administration had invented evidence of renewed Sandinist support for Salvadoran guerrillas to justify an increase in American military involvement in El Salvador.

title: Remy Rejects Offer
description: Jerry Remy and his agent have broken off contract talks with the Boston Red Sox after rejecting a five-year, $2.5 million offer. The Red Sox said the team planned to retain rights to the second baseman in Friday's re-entry draft to keep its proposal alive. ... Bill Russell, the Dodger shortstop, underwent foot surgery at Whittier Presbyterian Hospital in Los Angeles to repair a small-bone crack, a spokesman for the club said. Russell will wear a cast for six weeks.

title: NOTES ON FASHION
description: I N Kennedy Fraser's new book, ''The Fashionable Mind,'' a keen visual sense and the ability to express what the eye sees in words mesh often enough to reach a high-water mark in fashion writing. Consisting of essays gleaned from her 11-year career as fashion columnist for The New Yorker, Miss Fraser's writing is, at its best, intellectual without being leaden, chatty without being silly and intimate without being offensive.

title: Marathon Oil Hearing
description: Judge John M. Manos has scheduled a hearing for this morning in Cleveland Federal Court concerning the Marathon Oil Company's request that a temporary restraining order be extended at least until Nov. 17. The order, scheduled to expire at noon today, has prevented the Mobil Corporation from pressing its $85-a-share bid to acquire twothirds of Marathon's stock.

title: Vardi, Violist, Performs Sonata by Hindemith
description: Emanuel Vardi, who has had a long career as a solo violist, played his instrument with expert ease in a recital in Alice Tully Hall on Sunday night. But his playing also lacked what is commonly called ''personality.''

title: ARUNDEL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After losses from discontinued operations of $276,000 for the qr and $2.5 million for the 9 mos...C-Net loss after $6.2 million loss from discontinued operations... D-After $6.1 million loss from discontinued operations

title: Praise of Muddy Prose TO SCIENCE TIMES:
description: Your article ''Teachers Reward Muddy Prose, Study Finds'' (Oct. 27) exemplifies the problem. Take the sentence: Wordy papers got higher marks even when they were compared with concise ones that were somewhat better in terms of organization, arguments and grammar.

title: CHARLES E. RODGERS JR.
description: Charles E. Rodgers Jr., a Manhattan textile-marketing executive who was active in civic affairs in Westchester County, died Sunday at his home in Briarcliff Manor.

title: The Editorial Notebook; The Aluminum Conundrum
description: Imagine Country X, importing oil at $35 a barrel, refining it, and then re-exporting for one-quarter the price. Now imagine Country Y, the lucky recipient of Country X's export largess.

title: Crash Kills 11 in Spain
description: A train and a truck collided at a rail crossing near this city in northeast Spain today and rescue officials said at least 11 people were killed and 30 injured. All the victims were passengers of the train.

title: LABORITE LEADER STIRS ANGER AMONG BRITONS
description: Michael Foot, the leader of the opposition Labor Party, failed to wear black at a memorial service yesterday for Britain's war dead, causing an uproar that could threaten his political future.

title: TENNESSEE NATURAL GAS LINES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
STAGE: 'DRESSER,' A MONARCH AND HIS LOYAL VASSAL
description: THE dark and jagged set of Ronald Harwood's play ''The Dresser'' is the ratty backstage area - moldy dressing rooms, cramped corridors and wings - of a crumbling theater somewhere in the British provinces. The time is 1942, and the stink of death is in the air. Outside, there are howling sirens, signaling another Luftwaffe bombing raid. Inside, skulking about the gloom, are Mr. Harwood's central characters - two men who seem to have scant reason to live.

title: Faculty Rejects Contract At Boston University
description: Members of Boston University's faculty union voted 143 to 34 tonight to reject the administration's latest contract offer and threatened a strike if no agreement was reached by mid-January, when the next semester begins.

title: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 10, 1981; The Economy
description: The Administration has dropped its proposal to Congress for $3 billion in new revenue for 1982, Treasury Secretary Donald T. Regan said. The figure was part of President Reagan's Sept. 24 proposal to raise $22 billion in tax revenue over three years. Mr. Regan said in an interview that the larger package still stands. Meanwhile, Congressional analysts said the B-1 bombers sought by the President would cost $39.8 billion, double the Air Force's estimate. (Page A1.)

title: SAUTER TO BE PRESIDENT OF CBS NEWS
description: Van Gordon Sauter, president of CBS Sports for the past year, will be named president of CBS News today, succeeding William Leonard, who is scheduled to retire next May, highly placed sources at CBS confirmed late last night.

title: Seagram Offer
description: The Seagram Company, the world's largest producer of liquor and wines, said that about 13.6 million of its common shares had been tendered under its recently expired offer to buy 5 million of its own shares. Seagram said that about 37 percent of the shares tendered would be purchased. It said that as previously announced, all shares bought under the offer were being purchased on a prorated basis.

title: WILLIAMS REFLECTS ON FACING KNICKS
description: The crowd of reporters around Ray Williams's locker was beginning to thin. A few minutes before, the Nets backcourt man had completed his best game of the young National Basketball Association season.

title: BRIEFING
description: S ECRETARY of Health and Human Services Richard S. Schweiker, in his newest proposals for major cuts in Federal welfare and health care costs, has quietly sought to exclude his own staff from further budget reductions. In a letter to David A. Stockman, director of the Office of Management and Budget, Mr. Schweiker proposed cuts in Medicare and Medicaid but said that looming reductions in his staff ''are not appropriate.'' Mr. Schweiker said, ''At present, our Congressional liaison, planning, budget, finance, legal and public affairs staffs are taxed to their limits in support of this Administration's program and policy changes.'' He argued that these employees were needed ''because program changes in this department are so profound'' and ''require top-down direction from the office of the Secretary and will be implemented over the next several years.''

title: 3 STATES TELL HEARING THEY WON'T FILL WELFARE GAP
description: Gov. Lamar Alexander of Tennessee and welfare officials from Arkansas and Mississippi told a Congressional hearing today that their states would not increase welfare spending to fill the gaps created by Federal budget cuts.

title: BIG GERMAN BANK OMITS 2D DIVIDEND
description: Despite a sharp improvement in its operating earnings, Commerzbank, West Germany's third-largest commercial bank, has announced it will omit payment of a dividend this year for the second consecutive year.

title: GREAT BASINS PETROLEUM CO reports earnings for Yr to July 31
description: B-Including $4,163,000 extraordinary tax credit...C-Net loss after $390,000 loss from discontinued operations

title: Marsteller Gains
description: Wendy's of Pittsburgh Inc. has named Marsteller Inc.'s Pittsburgh office as its regional advertising agency for 40 Wendy's restaurants in the Pittsburgh and Johnstown/Altoona areas. The account's current billings are about $1 million, and had been handled by Jay Reich Advertising, also in Pittsburgh.

title: THE PREVALENCE OF PRAGMATIC PREGNANCY
description: To the Editor:

title: ARABS MAY QUESTION OMAN'S MILITARY TIES TO U.S.
description: Oman's agreement to let United States Marines land on its shores in maneuvers may be challenged at a meeting of Persian Gulf states opening here today.

title: NO PLAN TO INTERVENE IN EL SALVADOR, REAGAN SAYS
description: President Reagan said today that his Administration had no plans to send troops to El Salvador, although he acknowledged that the effort by the United States-backed Government there to defeat leftist insurgents may have reached a stalemate.

title: NATIONAL OLD LINE INSURANCE CO reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
ARAB-JEWISH RELATIONS OFF-LIMITS TO ISRAEL TV
description: Israel's only television station, a stateowned channel that comes under frequent political pressure from the Government, is refusing to broadcast reports that delve into the area of Arab-Jewish relations.

title: RICKOVER'S ALLIES PREPARE TO RESIST HIS RETIREMENT
description: Representative Samuel S. Stratton and Senator Henry M. Jackson began to gather Congressional forces today in an effort to keep the Reagan Administration from easing out Adm. Hyman G. Rickover, 81 years old, as the Navy's chief nuclear officer.

title: RELIABILITY INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After foreign currency losses of $30,515 for the qr and $215,132 for the 9 mos...C-After foreign currency losses $11,959 for the qr and $33,490 for the 9 mos and foreign tax benefits of $8,800 for the qr and $82,000 for the 9 mos

title: HCC INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 26
description: B-Includes a pretax charge to earnings of $1,250,000 for provision for loss on discontinued product lines and writedown of assets...C-Net income

title: TEMPLETON ENERGY INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-The company began operation on July 1,1981

title: NEW BOND ISSUES GROW IN SIZE
description: With strong investor demand for new tax-exempt and corporate bond issues, investment bankers were able to increase the size of new issues yesterday or move up offering dates.

title: News Analysis
description: In every new Administration there comes a time, after the initial policies have been set out, when so much skepticism and political resistance develops that the President must aggressively defend the credibility of his program and his own leadership.

title: Exxon and Pepsico to Donate Money to Aid Black Colleges
description: Two major corporations announced yesterday that they would make substantial contributions to Negro colleges in the United States. The Exxon Education Foundation has awarded $1.8 million in grants over three years to six black colleges.

title: PENNCORP FINANCIAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After losses from discontinued operations of $6,872,000 for the qr and $15,300,000 for the 9 mos and $221,000 investmen loss for the qr and $382,000 investment gain for the 9 mos... C-Net income including investment gains of $266,000 for the qr and $1,108,000 for the 9 mos and $59,000 loss for the qr from discontinued operations and $334,000 gain for the 9 mos from discontinued operations

title: SUNSHINE-JR STORES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Yr-ago results have been restated to reflect a change to LIFO method of inventory accounting

title: QUERIES ARISE ON BACKGROUND OF BALLOT TASK FORCE OFFICIAL
description: Apparent discrepancies have arisen about the background of a Republican National Committee official, John A. Kelly, who organized the ''National Ballot Security Task Force'' in the election for Governor of New Jersey.

title: Dr. Edrita Fried Dead; Psychoanalyst Was 70
description: Dr. Edrita Fried, a psychoanalyst who was senior supervisor and training analyst at the Postgraduate Center for Mental Health in Manhattan and director of the center's Performing Arts Counseling Service, died Monday at St. Luke's Hospital. She was 70 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: ATICO FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including $466,363 or 23 cents a shr income from discontinued operations

title: Tax Comment By Stockman
description: David A. Stockman, the budget director, says President Reagan's tax cut is designed to aid rich people while being promoted as helping everybody, according to an article in the Atlantic Monthly magazine.

title: Transactions
description: BASEBALL

title: Key Rates
description: * Rates are before any surcharges on loans to large banks that are frequent borrowers.** Maximum rate payable by savings institutions.Salomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: Germans Pro-American, Schmidt Declares
description: Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany told a group of West German publishers today that the fundamental attitude of the German people and its political leadership, both of the right and the left, was pro-American and in favor of the alliance with the United States.

title: ADOBE OIL & GAS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
FOR BETTER LIVING INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After $11,000 loss from discontinued operations

title: GETTING IT ALL TOGETHER AT DINNER PARTIES
description: LACK of time, lack of space, lack of expertise -all those are legitimate and often-heard excuses for not giving a dinner party. But in the coming festive season, not having a party is not always an option. So when pressed, the host or hostess will call in a caterer or stop in at the gourmet carryout in order to feed guests with a minimum amount of effort. For some people anything is preferable to the work involved in cooking the meal at home.

title: N.B.A. Cites Casino Ties
description: Citing preservation of ''integrity,'' the National Basketball Association has ordered the San Diego Clippers to sever their ties with hotel-casino operations the club has used in promotions.

title: CITY FINDS WELFARE PENALTIES COST LESS THAN THE REMEDIES
description: New York City's welfare agency, warned that it may be penalized tens of millions of dollars in Federal funds because of inefficiency, has indicated that it would find it easier and less expensive to suffer the penalty than to correct the mistakes.

title: Real Estate; Net Leases, In the Style Of Hawaii
description: THE unlikely missionary in the city for real estate activity in the Hawaiian style is a 37-year-old native of Brooklyn named Stephen J. Meringoff. The circuitous route to his present perch high in the Seagram Building on Park Avenue took him through Cornell University, the Harvard Business School, Denver and Honolulu.

title: Lomax in the Wings
description: Neil Lomax, the rookie from Portland State, may be replacing Jim Hart, the 37-year-old veteran, as No.1 quarterback of the St. Louis Cardinals as early as Sunday against Buffalo. Coach Jim Hanifan, whose team has a record of 3-7, had said he planned to use Lomax frequently late in the season, but yesterday he went a step beyond that.

title: A TERRINE FOR PATE
description: THE most ambitious home cooks I know have all tried their hands at one of the most time-consuming and demanding of dishes, the elaborate pate. They have usually attempted a relatively easy dish first, the pate campagne, or country pate, which is essentially blended chopped meat, made rapidly with a food processor.

title: PRESIDENT'S NEWS CONFERENCE ON FOREIGN AND DOMESTIC MATTERS
description: Following is a transcript of President Reagan's news conference in Washington yesterday, as recorded by The New York Times: OPENING STATEMENT

title: 10 Hurt, 64 Arrested At Hartford Concert
description: Sixty-four persons were arrested and 10 were injured during the first of two sold-out Rolling Stones concerts at the Hartford Civic Center Coliseum, the police said today.

title: TOP OIL EXECUTIVES SEE LITTLE CHANGE IN PRICES
description: Leaders of the American oil industry predicted today that oil prices would stagnate for a year or more. The executives, who assembled here yesterday for the annual meeting of the American Petroleum Institute, said that this meant continuation of a trend that has seen the average price of a gallon of gasoline decline by nearly 5 cents since March, to $1.34.

title: SUNBEAM CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After foreign exchange losses of $954,000 for the qr and $1,019,000 for the 6 mos and credits to costs of goods sold of $3,334,000 for the qr and $518,000 for the 6 mos and $1,970,000 Britain tax benefit and $4,327,000 tax benefit from the disposition of a Brazillan subsidiary in the 1982 fiscal second qr

title: WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 11, 1981; The Economy
description: President Reagan, though adamant about spending cuts, will defer until next year proposing the basic reductions in Federal benefit programs that he had called for six weeks ago. At a news conference, Mr. Reagan made his gloomiest assessment yet of the immediate economic outlook, but predicted that the economy would rebound next spring or early next summer. (Page A1.)

title: LIBYAN OFFICER PREDICTS RETURN OF WAR IN CHAD
description: The commander of Libya's remaining troops in Chad said today that civil war would return to this country once his soldiers completed their withdrawal and were replaced by an African peacekeeping force.

title: Market Place; Life Insurance For Investors
description: THE New York Stock Exchange is informing member firms of an improved life insurance plan for investors. Unlike a year-old plan limiting coverage to a mere $15,000, the new one offers unlimited coverage.

title: SIGMA-ALDRICH CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Ex-Paribas Head Charged
description: The former chairman of Compagnie Financiere de Paris et des Pays-Bas, the French holding company that is to be taken over shortly by the state, was charged today with breaking exchange control laws, officials announced.

title: RESTAURANTS: BIG 3 IN WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON RESTAURANT fever seems to have hit the nation's capital in epidemic proportions. A relative gastronomic backwater only 10 years ago, Washington now boasts dozens of creditable and fashionable French, Asian and North Italian dining places. Restaurant hopping is the second favorite game in town, nosed out only by politics, and nouvelle cuisine oneupmanship is rampant among would-be superstar chefs, most of them from France.

title: JAMESBURY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 10
WATT AND FOES ARE BEST OF ENEMIES
description: Under the circumstances, Interior Secretary James G. Watt might just be the best thing that could have happened to the nation's environmental groups. And, vice versa, as it is turning out.

title: BEST BUYS
description: THE average cost of feeding a family of four inched up 14 cents to $105.22 during the two-week period that ended last Friday, according to the market basket survey of the city's Department of Consumer Affairs. Shoppers would have paid $5.18 more for the 41 items in the market basket than during the same period last year.

title: News Analysis
description: In language that is almost disarmingly simple for the legal profession, Rule 3(c) of the Southern District Court of New York grants its Federal judges wide discretion on whether to allow an outof-state attorney to practice before them.

title: COUNTDOWN FOR SHUTTLE BEGINS AGAIN
description: The countdown for the space shuttle Columbia's second flight began again today, and the two astronauts returned here to prepare for the launching that was to have been last Wednesday and is now scheduled for Thursday.

title: CASTLE & COOKE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 10
KARPOV WINS GAME 14
description: Viktor Korchnoi of Switzerland today resigned the adjourned 14th game of his world championship chess match with Anatoly Karpov of the Soviet Union, the titleholder. The challenger's signed capitulation was delivered to Paul Klein of Ecuador, the head referee, at 3 P.M. by Alban Broadbeck, Korchnoi's lawyer.

title: POLES ASK ADMITTANCE INTO I.M.F.
description: Poland formally applied today for membership in the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank. Its action opened the door to the possibility of loans from these institutions as a means of dealing with its mounting financial and economic problems.

title: Brazilian Leader Returning
description: President Joao Baptista Figueiredo will resume his duties Thursday after an absence of almost eight weeks following a heart attack, a presidential spokesman said today. General Figueiredo, the fifth in a line of military presidents, was taken ill Sept. 18. Vice President Aureliano Chaves, a civilian, was sworn in five days later as interim head of state pending General Figueiredo's recovery.

title: Benton & Bowles Loses Holland America
description: Holland America Cruises, which for the past five years has been a client of Benton & Bowles, has bid the agency bon voyage and announced its intention to seek a new shop.

title: POLICY UNCHANGED, EGYPTIAN AIDE SAYS
description: President Hosni Mubarak's remarks reaffirming Egypt's commitment to a policy of nonalignment in foreign affairs, as well as his positive response to the Saudi peace plan, does not change Egypt's relationship to the United States or its support of the Camp David accords, according to a senior Egyptian official.

title: BAKER INTERNATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Kone Purchases Armor Elevator
description: The Armor Elevator Company based here has been sold for an undisclosed price to the Kone Corporation, a Finnish company that now becomes the third-ranked elevator manufacturer in the United States.

title: BULOVA WATCH CO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including pretax foreign currency translation gains of $1,051,000 for the qr and $2,708,000 for the 9 mos, pretax gains from the disposition of assets of $215,000 for the qr and $1,743,000 for the 9 mos and $1,311,000 tax benefit for the 9 mos...C-Including $389,000 pretax gain for the qr and $624,000 pretax loss for the 9 mos from foreign currency translations, pretax gains from the disposition of assets of $766,000 for the qr and $1,748,000 for the 9 mos tax benefits of $285,000 for the qr and $1,405,000 for the 9 mos and $489,000 extraordinary tax credit for the qr and 9 mos

title: BRIEFS
description: * Billig Family Investments said it and 15 other entities acting as a group hade increased their stake in the Chicago Milwaukee Corporation to 814,900 shares, or 33.2 percent, through the acquisition of 173,900 shares bought between Oct. 21 and Nov. 6 at prices ranging from $46 a share to $61 a share.

title: HONORING VETERANS OF WAR, AND ANTI-WAR
description: To the Editor:

title: CERTAIN-TEED'S LONG-RANGE CONCERNS
description: There is a bit of uneasiness these days at the Certain-Teed Corporation, a building-materials manufacturer that is suffering, along with others, from the current housing slump.

title: Bulls 119, Kings 107
description: CHICAGO (AP) - Artis Gilmore scored 28 points and had four dunks late in the game to pace Chicago.

title: LOEWS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-After realized investment losses of $5,515,000 for the qr and $23,937,000 for the 9 mos and $3,842,000 nonrecurring charge for the 9 mos from discontinued operations...C-Including $5,810,000 realized gain for the qr and $8,615,000 realized loss for the 9 mos from investments

title: SOVIET ACCUSES SWEDES ON LISTENING POST
description: While the Soviet press has not mentioned Sweden's accusations that a Soviet submarine in a recent incident was spying, the official Soviet press agency said today that Sweden had long engaged in electronic espionage against the Soviet Union.

title: HANNAFORD BROS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 3
News Analysis
description: The $4.3 billion merger of the Connecticut General Corporation and the INA Corporation is quite different from the huge mergers that have startled the insurance industry this year, but it was shaped by the same need.

title: ENERGY RESOURCES OF NORTH DAKOTA INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including tax credits of $351,000 or 2 cents a shr for the qr and $620,300 or 4 cents a shr for the 6 mos...C-Net loss...D-Including $178,422 credit from an accounting change

title: PETTIBONE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
AFFILIATED CAPITAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: B-Including $993,425 or 89 cents a shr tax credit for the qr and $4,055,000 pretax gain on the sale of land for the 9 mos...C-Net loss

title: QUEEN AND A FIRST LADY AT CHARITY GALA
description: THE man was wearing an exuberant brown checked suit and his wife was in restrained gray polyester. They stood in the lobby of the Waldorf-Astoria on Monday night, obviously mesmerized.

title: CHINA TAUNTS SOVIET ON SUBMARINE STRANDING
description: China has seized upon the incident of the Soviet submarine that went aground recently near a Swedish naval base to buttress its contention that the growing pacifist movement in Western Europe is being misled by the Soviet Union.

title: MOSLEM MILITANTS WORRYING TUNISIA
description: President Habib Bourguiba is reportedly concerned over apparent gains in popularity made by Islamic fundamentalists with attacks on the Tunisian Government's policies of modernization and secularization.

title: Letter: On Dropouts Giving Credit for Quality Teaching
description: To the Editor: It is regrettable that the editorial ''A Fake Stick for School Dropouts'' (Oct. 2) opposed the efforts of the New York Board of Regents to set standards for the accreditation of high schools. The Regents deserve applause for recognizing that the effectiveness of a school must be measured by indicators of instructional quality.

title: Sudan Disbands Cabinet; Currency Devalued
description: President Gaafar al-Nimeiry of the Sudan has dismissed his Cabinet and announced a sweeping austerity program in an effort to save the economy from collapse.

title: PERSONAL HEALTH
description: BOTH in myth and medicine the womb, when not engaged in childbearing, has been seen as the source of many female woes, ranging from emotional disorders to cancer. Thus it is hardly surprising that the advent of relatively safe surgical and anesthetic techniques in the mid-20th century brought with it a great increase in the rate of hysterectomy -surgical removal of the uterus, or womb, usually after a woman has completed childbearing.

title: TRAINER DROPS PLEA, ACCEPTS 30-DAY BAN
description: Stanley Hough, one of New York's leading trainers of thoroughbred horses, yesterday dropped his appeal of a drug-related suspension imposed last winter and agreed to a reduced suspension of 30 days, effective Sunday.

title: CITY OPERA CUTS PRICES 20% TO SPUR ATTENDENCE
description: Faced with a sharp decline in attendance and subscriptions, the New York City Opera today is announcing a 20 percent across-the-board cut on all subscriptions for its spring and future seasons. This decision to cut prices comes at a time when most cultural and entertainment enterprises have been increasing their prices. Subscribers who have ordered tickets for the spring season, which runs from Feb. 26 through March 2, will receive rebates pegged to the new scales.

title: AUDIOTRONICS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Ginsberg to Read 'Howl' Saturday at Columbia
description: On the 25th anniversary of the publication of ''Howl,'' Allen Ginsberg's poem that was a landmark for the beat generation of writers, the author will give a full reading of his work Saturday night at Columbia University's McMillin Theater.

title: Celtics 90, Bullets 84
description: Kevin McHale, replacing Robert Parish, who was ejected for fighting, scored 12 of his 21 points in the fourth quarter to pace Boston.

title: DAMON CREATIONS INC reports earnings for 9 mos to Sept 30
TORSTAR CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
